channel.title: Homes on Mohamed Elawady Webpage
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Mohamed Elawady Webpage

item.description: Biography I am a PhD Candidate in Image Science and Computer Vision Department, Hubert Curien laboratory, under the supervision of Christophe Ducottet (Leader, Image Analysis and Understanding team). And I was previously MSc intern at Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh in the School of Engineering and Physical Science, Vision Lab under the supervision of Neil M. Robertson (Director of Research for Speech, Image and Vision Systems, Queen’s University of Belfast). I was awarded triple-degree 2-years European Masters in Vision and Robotics (VIBOT) with Erasmus Mundus Scholarship (2012-2014).

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I have teaching experience in different courses in computer science as a graduate research assistant in Faculty of Computers and Informatics, Suez Canal University, Egypt (2008-2012). Knowledge-Based Systems (Undergraduate) [2009-2010] File Processing and Organization (Undergraduate) [2009-2010] Computer Programming (Undergraduate) [2010] Programming Language Concepts (Undergraduate) [2010] Also, I participated in undergraduate and postgraduate courses (lectures, tutorials and practical sessions) during 4-years PhD period in international masters programs of Jean Monnet University (COSI, CIMET, 3DMT, MLDM) and Telecom St-Etienne (2014-2018).
